issue.title: Publishing on atlas_sim_interface_state from bag file causes issues with simulated robot

message.raw:
I can duplicate the effect by replaying this bag file after starting up Gazebo.
It causes the robot to "jump", then fall over.  I notice that the current_behavior seems to oscillate between 0 and 3 or 7 after it falls.
message.html: I can duplicate the effect by replaying this bag file after starting up Gazebo. It causes the robot to "jump", then fall over. I notice that the current_behavior seems to oscillate between 0 and 3 or 7 after it falls.

issue.title: Publishing on atlas_sim_interface_state from bag file causes issues with simulated robot

message.raw:
@dcconner I noticed that the bag file you posted has the following topics:
~~~
$ rosbag info 2015-01-09-16-56-42.bag 
...
topics:      /atlas/atlas_command                     1 msg     : atlas_msgs/AtlasCommand            
             /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command       1 msg     : atlas_msgs/AtlasSimInterfaceCommand
             /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state     12970 msgs    : atlas_msgs/AtlasSimInterfaceState
~~~
If I play it back, I do see the jump and fall over behavior.

I'm wondering why the `/atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state` is included? I tried filtering that topic out of the bag file (see attached 2015-01-09-16-56-42_no_state.bag), and when I play that bag file, it doesn't fall over.
message.html:
@dcconner I noticed that the bag file you posted has the following topics:

$ rosbag info 2015-01-09-16-56-42.bag 
...
topics:      /atlas/atlas_command                     1 msg     : atlas_msgs/AtlasCommand            
             /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command       1 msg     : atlas_msgs/AtlasSimInterfaceCommand
             /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state     12970 msgs    : atlas_msgs/AtlasSimInterfaceState

If I play it back, I do see the jump and fall over behavior.

I'm wondering why the /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state is included? I tried filtering that topic out of the bag file (see attached 2015-01-09-16-56-42_no_state.bag), and when I play that bag file, it doesn't fall over.

issue.title: Publishing on atlas_sim_interface_state from bag file causes issues with simulated robot

message.raw:
Gah.
Apparently I was publishing a  control_mode ="User" once on start up.
Was this used to switch from demo mode in past, and now is causing a BDI behavior mode change with the new library?
message.html: Gah. Apparently I was publishing a control_mode ="User" once on start up. Was this used to switch from demo mode in past, and now is causing a BDI behavior mode change with the new library?

content.new:
In trying to debug issue caused by old code that was publishing control_mode="User" once on startup (but didn't cause issues with atlas_v3 - see #471), we ran into issue with replaying bag file.

content.old:
Trying to run our interface with new library 4.2.4-1~trusty  with BDI 3.0.2

Upon publishing the first message of AtlasSimInterfaceCommand and AtlasCommand, the robot changes to USER mode and falls over.
